content: this is Dean G and we're going down on to make a sewer down pipe
all right a sewer down pipe so this is essentially a dead end and I've created
the tiles from this of the previous two videos and I've just cut out extra part
of the layer so that there's the first layer is missing towards the end of the
corridor and now I'm going to grab a toilet paper
roll or cardboard tube and the same width as a toilet paper roll and now I'm
just going to have the seven millimeters from the top so that gives you the
height of what would be the second layer you could go up to the third layer if
you wanted to I just said I never go above three layers but they've got the
walls segments on there so this this is essentially the third layer so I'm doing
just gonna cut a using the craft knife cut into where I've measured and then
I'm going to create a big enough hole to put a pair of scissors in and then cut
the rest just a lot easier and tidy here to do it that way just getting started
with the craft night so essentially this is going to form the pipe where effluent
will flow down from a higher level or from outside and it could be used as an
access point or not that I would personally want to use it but there you
go so the effluent has to flow out of this
pipe so I'm going to cut it two and a half centimeter or one inch gap and that
will give the space with the effluent will be able to flow out so now I'm just
going to apply some hot glue to the tile and place that piece of pipe there and
just secure it in place and then apply hot glue as we did in the previous sewer
videos to show the flow of effluent and now we're going to work on the influent
actually coming down from above so we need to build that up a bit so you need
to hold the tile at an angle and start to squirt in hot glue it will take a
while to dry and it's probably better to hold it at an angle like this or you can
prop it up against something so it remains in that angle
what I'm doing is is using put some polystyrene to bulk it up you could use
pretty much anything sand or extra cut bits of cardboard or something I'm just
grabbing some polystyrene that'll just add a little bit of bulk to it and then
I'll apply a hot glue over the top once it is painted you wouldn't be able to
see that so when you're using something just consider the sort of detritus you
would want in the effluent when it is coming down the pipe so just applying
more hot glue here and this sort of has a definite flow from above look and
Holly until it cools down and cures so now we've applied paint as in videos
three four and five and in the sewer video for the grating ends effluent and
now I'm just applying some water-based high gloss varnish the step is merely to
give it that sort of liquid Sheen it makes it look like liquid so it also
looks like wet paint but yeah it just gives it an interesting feel so that's
how I make a sewer down pipe now if you like this video like button prepare to
share and give it to your friends so they too can find out the wonderful
world of sewer ization they get some in sewer and hey you can check me out on
